message.content:
cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.DS, cs.DB

This paper deals with privacy-preserving text perturbation, which falls under the category of privacy-preserving data analysis. Therefore, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of word embedding models, which are commonly used in natural language processing, suggesting that cs.CL (Computation and Language) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also presents a privacy proof and conducts experiments to demonstrate the tradeoff between privacy and utility, indicating that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper deals with large-scale analysis, suggesting that cs.DB (Databases) is a possible sub-category as well.
